subject: Re: [junit] Re: Problem with RemoteTestRunner
msgSnippet: ... You only need the source for it if you want to step through/into it.  However, it s quite likely that the NullPointer is not in the RemoteTestRunner.  I
messageBody:
On Friday 16 July 2004 01:39 am, kk_oop wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> > kk_oop wrote:
> > > Hi.  I was running a test suite under JUnit version 3.7.0 through
> > > XDE/Eclipse version 2.0.1 and I got a null pointer error.  When I
> > > stepped through the program, I saw that the error occurs right when I
> > > get a window telling me
> > > that "org.eclipse.jdt.runner.RemoteTestRunner" type cannot be found.
> > > Do I need this type?  It does not seem to be in the junit.jar file.
> >
> > It sounds like you need it. It's part of the Eclipse JUnit integration.
> > --
>
> Do you know where it is supposed to be?  I'm not sure if it's not
> there, or if it is there and Eclipse just isn't seeing it.

You only need the source for it if you want to step through/into it. However,
it's quite likely that the NullPointer is not in the RemoteTestRunner. I
have used the Eclipse JUnit integration since ~2001 and have not run into
problems like this in the runner (at least not that I can recall). It's more
likely that the error is in your code and is being masked. I would advise
setting some strategic breakpoints and stepping through your test code.
However, if you really want the source to the plugin, you can find out how to
check it out of CVS here: http://dev.eclipse.org/cvshowto.html
